channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Actor
channel.description: Latest threat actor threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Advanced Threat Actor Exploits Cisco and Citrix Zero-Days in Targeted Attacks on Network Infrastructure
item.description:
Amazon's threat intelligence team has discovered an advanced threat actor actively exploiting two previously undisclosed zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Service Engine (ISE) and Citrix NetScaler Application Delivery Controllers (ADC). The vulnerabilities, now tracked as CVE-2025-20337 (Ci...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Clop Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Dartmouth College, Threatens to Leak Data
item.description:
The notorious Clop ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Dartmouth College, an Ivy League university in the U.S. On November 11, 2025, the group added the institution to its dark web leak site, threatening to publish exfiltrated data if the university does not enter ne...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iranian APT 'Ferocious Kitten' Continues to Target Dissidents With Custom MarkiRAT Surveillance Malware
item.description:
The Iranian-aligned APT group 'Ferocious Kitten' continues its long-running cyber-espionage campaign against Iranian dissidents and activists, according to new research from Picus Security. Active since at least 2015, the group uses spear-phishing emails with malicious Office documents to deploy its...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

item.title: Critical Triofox Zero-Day Actively Exploited for System-Level Access
item.description:
A critical, unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-12480) in Gladinet's Triofox file-sharing platform is being actively exploited by a threat group tracked as UNC6485. The attackers are bypassing authentication by spoofing HTTP Host headers to 'localhost', allowing them to cre...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: KONNI APT Weaponizes Google's Find Hub for Destructive Attacks
item.description:
The North Korea-linked threat group KONNI has been observed in a novel campaign targeting individuals in South Korea. The attackers use social engineering to deploy PC malware that steals Google account credentials. With these credentials, they access the victim's Google account and abuse the legiti...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

item.title: State-Backed Hacking Escalates: Russia Targets Ukraine, China Eyes Latin America
item.description:
A new report from ESET reveals a significant escalation in cyber operations by state-sponsored threat groups from Russia and China between April and September 2025. Russia-aligned groups, notably Sandworm, have accelerated destructive wiper malware attacks against Ukraine's critical infrastructure, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

item.title: Conti's Ghost: New 'DragonForce' Ransomware Adopts Cartel Model
item.description:
A new ransomware operation named DragonForce has been identified by security researchers, notable for its use of leaked source code from the infamous Conti ransomware. Instead of a traditional Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) model, DragonForce operates with a 'cartel-like' structure, providing affili...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

item.title: Insider Threat Shocker: Cybersecurity Pros Indicted for Wielding ALPHV/BlackCat Ransomware
item.description:
In a severe breach of trust, two cybersecurity professionals, Ryan Clifford Goldberg and Kevin Tyler Martin, have been indicted for allegedly conducting ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware attacks against at least five U.S. companies. The individuals, who held roles in incident response and ransomware negotia...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Incident Response

item.title: Microsoft Discovers 'SesameOp' Backdoor Using OpenAI API for Covert C2
item.description:
Microsoft's Detection and Response Team (DART) has discovered a novel backdoor named 'SesameOp' that uniquely uses the OpenAI Assistants API for its command-and-control (C2) communications. Found during an espionage investigation, the malware hides its malicious traffic within legitimate API calls t...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

item.title: Europe Now #2 Global Ransomware Target, Attacks Accelerating to 24-Hour Deployments
item.description:
Europe is now the second-largest global target for ransomware, accounting for 22% of all victims, according to CrowdStrike's 2025 European Threat Landscape Report. The report highlights a dramatic increase in attack speed, with groups like SCATTERED SPIDER now able to deploy ransomware in just 24 ho...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Threat Actor
